maml:description.maml:para: Returns an image's properties along with the replication progress status across the replica locations.
Returns an image's properties along with the replication progress status across the replica locations.
Name of the image in the user image library.
Name of the image in the user image library.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns the image from user image repository with the replication progress status across the target locations.

maml:description.maml:para: Deletes the replicas of the platform image from all of the replica locations.
Deletes the replicas of the platform image from all of the replica locations.
Name of the image in user image repository.
Name of the image in user image repository.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Replicas of "Win7UserImage" is deleted from all the locations.

maml:description.maml:para: Allows to replicate the image to target replica locations or allows to share/stop sharing the replicated images.
Specifies the name of the image in the user image library.
Specifies the locations that image will be replicated
Specifies the sharing permission of replicated image.
Specifies the name of the image in the user image library.
Specifies the name of the image in the user image library.
Specifies the sharing permission of replicated image.
Specifies the locations that image will be replicated

dev:remarks.maml:para: Starts the replication of the "Win7UserImage" from the user image repository to "West US" and "East US" locations.
Shares the replicas of Win7UserImage with Public if the replication is completed, otherwise the request is recorded and when the replication completes after then they are shared.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
Set-AzurePlatformVMImage -ImageName Win7UserImage -Permission Private
Stops the sharing of the replicas of Win7UserImage with Public.

maml:description.maml:para: Publishes a brand new extension or publish a newer version of an existing version. Extensions can be published as external or internal using this cmdlet but a brand new version is always published as internal by default.
Not Specified
Not Specified
Once an extension version is registered (as public or internal), this cmdlet allows the publisher to modify the extension properties without changing version number.
